item.title: Climate change: IPCC report is 'code red for humanity'
item.description: Heating from humans has caused irreparable damage to the Earth that may get worse in coming decades.

item.title: The nightclubs getting young people vaccinated
item.description: Venues across the UK are offering jabs in an effort to get more young people immunised.

item.title: Vodafone to bring back roaming charges from January
item.description: It follows EE's decision to reintroduce daily charges for using phone tariffs while in Europe

item.title: Anger at overflowing Covid test drop boxes
item.description: Provider Randox says it is increasing collections but the tests for UK arrivals are branded "pointless".

item.title: Bute Park attack: Gary Jenkins dies 16 days after incident
item.description: Father-of-two Dr Gary Jenkins had been in hospital since the attack in a Cardiff Park on 20 July.

item.title: Shishov case: Belarus leader Lukashenko denies link to dissident's death
item.description: Alexander Lukashenko insists he had nothing to do with a suspicious hanging in Ukraine last week.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: Accuser Brittany Commisso says governor broke law
item.description: Brittany Commisso speaks for the first time about alleged groping incidents with New York governor.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Sudesh Amman operation 'an effective result'
item.description: Sudesh Amman was shot dead by surveillance officers after stabbing two people in south London.

item.title: Covid: Home-working officials won't get paid less, says minister
item.description: Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng said mixing home and office working was "here to stay" post-Covid.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca: Protesters march on Downing Street
item.description: More than 100,000 people sign a petition calling on Boris Johnson to halt the alpaca's execution.

item.title: London's Tower Bridge stuck open after technical failure
item.description: Police warn drivers to avoid the area around the famous London landmark.

item.title: Chelsea's Ivy Asia restaurant sorry for 'culturally insensitive' advert
item.description: The video features women dressed as geishas being pulled in a rickshaw to the restaurant.

item.title: Extreme weather: How it is connected to climate change?
item.description: Heatwaves, wildfires, floods and droughts highlight how extreme weather is linked to climate change.

item.title: Climate change: Make coal history says PM after climate warning
item.description: Boris Johnson calls for a shift towards clean energy sources after "sobering" report on climate change.

item.title: Climate change: Five things we have learned from the IPCC report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: What is climate change? A really simple guide
item.description: BBC News looks at what we know and don't know about the Earth's changing climate.

item.title: Climate Basics: Your carbon footprint explained
item.description: BBC Reality Check's Chris Morris explains how changing three aspects of how you live can make the biggest dent to your carbon footprint.

item.title: COP26: Minister says summit must be a turning point
item.description: Zac Goldsmith says COP26 must be a "turning point", despite warnings that costs of tackling climate change will hit poor families.

item.title: Climate Basics: CO2 explained
item.description: CO2 is at the heart of our changing climate. Here's why.

item.title: Floods: Research shows millions more at risk of flooding
item.description: Numbers of people exposed to flooding globally have risen by almost a quarter in two decades.

item.title: Then and now: The burning issue of wildfires
item.description: Scientists are increasingly concerned climate change is making fires more frequent and more intense.

item.title: What do world leaders need to agree?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: COP26: How serious is the government about climate conference?
item.description: With less than 90 days to go to Glasgow climate summit, there is uncertainty surrounding the event.

item.title: Climate change: Time running out to stop catastrophe - Alok Sharma
item.description: Despite his warning, the Tory climate chief does not rule out future fossil fuel projects in the UK.

item.title: Climate Change: Half US cars to be zero-emission by 2030 - Biden
item.description: Cars produce nearly a third of US carbon emissions and sales of electric vehicles lag behind Europe.

item.title: New 'Banksy' artwork appears at Great Yarmouth model village
item.description: A new model, apparently signed by the artist, is found at a Great Yarmouth attraction.

item.title: Gymnast Max Whitlock gives swimmer Adam Peaty a pommel horse lesson
item.description: The swimmer tried out Max Whitlock's pommel horse as the two Olympic gold medallists appeared on BBC Breakfast.

item.title: Peter Kay charity shows: Cancer patient 'honoured'
item.description: Sometimes laughter is all you've got, says Laura Nuttall, who is receiving treatment for brain cancer.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Nightclubs reopen with celebrations and cheers
item.description: There were cheers as clubs were allowed to reopen after 16 months of Covid restrictions.

item.title: Daughter of 'Robocop' PC becomes Nottinghamshire Police officer
item.description: Rachel Evans says she was inspired to join Nottinghamshire Police after her dad made 309 arrests in a year.

item.title: Snorkeler's close encounter with 9ft basking shark
item.description: Wildlife ranger Craig Nisbet said the harmless giant swam within a metre of him as it fed on zooplankton.

item.title: How A Level and GCSE results are calculated
item.description: Education editor Branwen Jeffreys explains how grades are calculated and how you can appeal.

item.title: Greece wildfires: 'It's like a horror movie but it's real life'
item.description: Thousands of people have had to evacuate Greece's second biggest island as severe wildfires rage.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: All the best stats from the 2020 Games
item.description: World records, Team GB making more history, US v China, and all the best stats from the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games.

item.title: Mobile roaming charges in Europe: What you need to know
item.description: How much more will Britons have to pay to use their mobiles in Europe, now the UK has left the EU?

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Why China's climate policy matters to us all
item.description: The global battle against climate change is likely to be won or lost in China.

item.title: A-levels 2021: When do results come out?
item.description: For the second year running, pupils in England, Wales and Northern Ireland have not taken the exams.

item.title: Children's home fire: 'The souls of our daughters are still there'
item.description: The mothers of teenage girls who died in a 2017 fire at a children's home in Guatemala want justice.

item.title: Assam-Mizoram clash: 'It was like a war between two countries'
item.description: A long-running border dispute is affecting relations between two neighbouring Indian states.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: A look at how Team GB fared sport-by-sport compared to their funding.
item.description: How Great Britain fared sport-by-sport at the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games relative to their funding.

item.title: Can technology help authors write a book?
item.description: Writing a novel is notoriously difficult, but technology may give the writer a helping hand.

item.title: Covid in Sydney: Communities feel under siege as troops deployed
item.description: Residents say they're being treated like second-class citizens to stem a Covid outbreak.

item.title: Uninspired rugby and Erasmus antics - how will the Lions tour be remembered?
item.description: After a Lions series full of rancour and underwhelming rugby, how will the tour be remembered and where do the team go from here?

item.title: England v India: Joe Root coping well with pressure - Chris Silverwood
item.description: The rest of England's batters must "come to the party" to ease the workload on captain Joe Root, says head coach Chris Silverwood.

item.title: 'When teams came with 20-man squads, there wasn't enough room' - Brentford's unlikely rise to the Premier League
item.description: As Brentford prepare for their first top-flight season since 1947, BBC Sport looks back at their unlikely journey to join England's elite.

item.title: Aguero, Lukaku, Shearer: Memorable Premier League debuts by big-money signings
item.description: With the 2021-22 Premier League season just days away, we look back at some memorable debuts by big-money signings in England's top flight since 1992.

item.title: 'Our sport deserves to be played on the biggest stage' - will netball feature in the 2032 Games?
item.description: Netball Australia, with the support of World Netball, announces its goal for the sport to debut at the 2032 Brisbane Olympic Games.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England, Scotland and Wales but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules across the UK?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The number of people pinged by the Covid app has fallen significantly.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: ‘If only I’d found out earlier I had pelvic congestion syndrome’
item.description: Sophie Robehmed suffered from back and stomach pains for years before being diagnosed with PCS.

item.title: From Afghan interpreter to US homeless - the long road to the American dream
item.description: Thousands of Afghan interpreters have waited years to flee to the US. Arriving is a different story.

item.title: Riots 10 years on: The five summer nights when London burned
item.description: In August 2011 a man was shot dead by police in London, triggering the worst civil unrest in decades.

item.title: ‘I'm black, my partner's white - stop asking me if this is my baby’
item.description: When Ena Miller had a baby, she was unprepared for the constant comments about her daughter's skin tone.
